actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: Joint resolution directing the Attorney General to conduct an investigation of the finances of New York City to determine whether any violations of Federal laws have contributed to that city's financial crisis.

summary.text: Directs the Attorney General of the United States to investigate the books, documents, papers and records of the city of New York to determine whether any violation of any law of the United States has occurred or is occurring which has in any way helped to bring about or contributed to the occurrence of any prospective or actual default by the city of New York on its financial obligations. Requires the Attorney General to submit an interim and final report to Congress on such investigation. Specifies that the final report shall include detailed statements of (1) the findings of the Attorney General; and (2) any action which the Attorney General has taken with respect to any such violation. Provides that nothing in this resolution shall require the Attorney General to disclose the name or identity of any person who is actively under investigation by the Attorney General.

titles.title: Joint resolution directing the Attorney General to conduct an investigation of the finances of New York City to determine whether any violations of Federal laws have contributed to that city's financial crisis.
